website_summaries.verdict: Thicker than many other medical-grade gloves while still being easy to use.
pros: Durable enough for auto work and other heavy-duty jobs
cons: Sizing runs small, so make sure to order at least one size up

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very comfortable and offer pretty good protection. Must say though, order a size up. I normally wear medium gloves, sometimes large. I ordered the XL bc they were cheaper, and they fit like a normal large. No looseness really, am content with this. They hold up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee Brummett

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, they will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves , they will get the job done. Down stide is that the guage for your hand size is way off. lukyily I took a gamble and ordered the XL version despite the guage saying that a medium would be best for me. I uploaded an additional picture to show my handsize against a standardized wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I won't buy these again!
customer_reviews.text: I went to reorder and the price is up 31.6% - so I found "Adenna" gloves they are better & priced lower than these were 5 mos ago!
customer_reviews.author: Nan Ftokoe

customer_reviews.title: But that's better than smelling oil on my hands after a deep ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been a backyard mechanic for 15yrs or so, not once worrying about my hands. Spending time/money on hand cleaners such as Fast Orange and scrub scrub scrub with nail cleaner brushes, and still seem to miss harder to access areas around my nails. Now I've seen the light and put on a pair of these gloves before starting anything dealing with repairing/modifying anything on my cars. My only complaint which I don't know if it can be resolved is, sweat. My hands come out of the gloves wet and pruned(raisin fingertips). But that's better than smelling oil on my hands after a deep hand scrub... two days later.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not good in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in size XL thinking they were diamond grip brand - my mistake. The first few gloves in the 1st pack and the 1st glove in the second pack had ragged holes in them - looked like a manufacturing error as the package was sealed. Tried them on, and they were very tight for an XL. Also, not up to my standard of durability, set by diamond grip. Returning...
customer_reviews.author: Blakjack

customer_reviews.title: These LAST!
customer_reviews.text: Why use the thinner, blue ones? I've been using the thinner, blue nitrile gloves for years. Yea, they're better than the vinyl ones, lasting longer ... but not much longer . These black , thicker ones? These last a WHOLE LOT longer than the thinner ones... a WHOLE lot longer. I normally get X-Large gloves in everything for the finger length, so I did so with these.. . it seems it would have been better for me to get these in Large. I'd buy another box in Large, but since these last so long, I think it'll be at least a year ... or two, before I need another box.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Night Rider

customer_reviews.title: Great nitrile gloves, just a tad bit pricey compared to local.
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for dealing with chemicals and having to deal with anything that may be sharp such as working on a vehicle. They work good, they are a little more expensive here than they are locally I found out. I think these are a little better quality but I haven't been able to really tell too much of a difference yet. Some people maybe able to tell, I wish I could remember the local brand. Either way, it's a good brand here, if you need some Nitrile gloves these a great, just a tad bit pricey for me compared to local.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: But with these it is sooooo much better. These gloves are super thick and you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the "must haves" when camping!! No one likes to handle the potty pipe on the camper, you just don't want to touch the pipe to hook up and drain the tanks. But with these it is sooooo much better. These gloves are super thick and you don't have to worry about them splitting apart when you wear them. We can keep our hands protected and then just throw them away, it makes it so much easier. I have recommended to all our camping friends they need to get a box as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Nitrile Gloves for Automotive Work!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome! First, the other reviewers are spot on that these run a size small. The black nitrile gloves sold at Auto Zone I am a size Large, but these an XL is a snug fit. These are durable and much thicker in comparison to those sold at auto parts stores, but the dexterity is not sacrificed at all! Additionally, the pricing on these compared to the ones sold in auto stores is excellent! If you do any kind of work on cars or painting where you want your hands to be clean these are the nitrile gloves for you!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I love the thickness of these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love the thickness of these gloves. My primary use for these are my outdoor grills when I clean them and also when working on my lawn equipment. Great for kitchen use also if you are prepping meats for the grill. Other brands I have tried are too thin and break open easily. I have large hands and the Diamond gloves go on without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: gapwedge

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Order Size Up.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I normally would order a Large, but ordered a size up (XL) after reading other reviews. I had no problems with fit and just enough slack in gloves to make them comfortable, yet well fitted. Using these gloves when detailing car and have had no issues with rips and tears in the gloves. Would defintenly repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nnahh

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for the shop
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are thicker than the typical blue nitrile gloves that sell for about the same price or a little less. They are tough and can easily be reused because they go on and come off without tearing. Great for changing oil in the car or painting, or a ton of other activities where you don't want to get stuff on your hands but where you need dexterity. I doubt you could pick up a coin off a hard surface while wearing these, but for most uses they work great. They do not have any talc in them, but you can add some if you want. Being black, rather than blue, they look pretty cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: They have helped me in countless things from cleaning up my car to mixing spices for cooking. Have had these gloves over a year the ones I use now work exactly the same as the ones when I open the box. They have never broken on me before I'm done with them. Extremely flexible only gloves I've ever had that I haven't had to put three or four pairs on before I found a set that didn't break at extra large, much less last through whatever I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price skyrocketed?
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these a few times and have noticed the price is now about 2x the amount as when I first purchased them. Plus this last batch is all kinda stuck together and it takes a few moments to untangle a couple of gloves from the pack and then unwrinkle them to put on your hand. Gonna have to find something a little more budget friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Ridge Termite NC

customer_reviews.title: Good thickness, not overly hot to wear, good value too
customer_reviews.text: As far as gloves go, these are some of the better ones I have used. I have purchased these several times and I see no reason to switch. They're the perfect thickness, they fit well and they're not as hot as others I have tried a good while back. Don't hesitate, just buy it. You'll be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. RL

customer_reviews.title: Go to harbor freight if you want a glove that works and is inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive gloves that don't even match those at harbor freight for 1/4 the price
customer_reviews.author: kx5fast

customer_reviews.title: Decent for mechanic work
customer_reviews.text: I work in an auto repair shop. These gloves work very well for anything dealing with shop fluids. If you're doing heavy engine or transmission work then these will tear when they get snagged on something. My only gripe is this is the second box in a row where I've had a pair of gloves "melted" together. I'd chalk this up to production defect but not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They love to cook and BBQ a lot of different meats ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in two sizes, an XL for my husband and a small for my daughter for cooking purposes mainly. They love to cook and BBQ a lot of different meats but don't want meat juice from prepping all over their hands. They are super sturdy and never rip. They also work well for cleaning around the house and I even have acrylic nails.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Diamond Gloves X 6.3 mil Black Advance Nitrile Examination Powder-Free Gloves,
customer_reviews.text: I like having these on hand for those types of jobs! Can you ever have enough?
customer_reviews.author: William M. Doody

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are easy to put on, does not rip/tear easily. Fit is accurate and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Good for many uses - strong and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased when working on a wood project that involved staining the wood (don't like staining my hands at the same time...) have used for multiple other purposes (cleaning up particularly bad messes with sick kids, etc). These have not let me down - none have broken while in use and the fit for me was quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Erik --

customer_reviews.title: Good, still seeking thin-and-indestructible...
customer_reviews.text: Good. Still can't live up to the abuse I put gloves through (I've yet to find anything that can without being so thick as to be useless for detail work, like getting nuts onto hard-to-reach bolts.) Still, less shredded that normal blue nitrile gloves usually are for the same work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit
customer_reviews.text: These fit tighter than any XL nitrile gloves I have used. If you want them snug, these are for you. I get multiple uses out of my nitrile gloves. These are a bit of a pain to peel off for re-use. Good quality - tighter fit than I like.
customer_reviews.author: conservative dad

customer_reviews.title: A good product for general use.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of putting on these XL sized gloves. Normally I like tight fitting gloves, but the hands get soaked fast from perspiration. These looser fitting gloves allow for easier removal and are comfortable whether using a socket wrench or a paint brush. They seem fairly durable, allowing me to reuse them for tasks like household painting.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Melaney

customer_reviews.title: Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have been buy for several years now. Grat for outside work and cheap enough to throw away after use
customer_reviews.author: rosewood

customer_reviews.title: Very durable glove, runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a durable yet flexible nitrile glove for some time. This is the best so far. Does not seem affected by solvents and fluids used in motorbike repair. They will tear, but it takes some doing. As stated earlier they run small. I ordered a 2XL for my XL hands. The fit is very good. I have also ordered some flash chlorinated 6 mil gloves that are supposed to reduce perspiration. Will update when tested.
customer_reviews.author: Randle T. Bain

customer_reviews.title: The best disposable gloves I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best disposable gloves I've ever used. They slip on easily (I ordered on the larger side). The higher wrist is a nice touch. The material is much thicker than others I've used, so they hold up better. And yet you still have good finger sensation for the work. These are the only disposable gloves I will use from now on (or until they lower the quality).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband who enjoys using these in the garage working on cars. In addition he uses them when handling raw meat as he does not like to wash his hands too much. He says they fit though they are a tad bit snug and don't go down his wrist as far as he would like. He doesn't have super large hands when compared to his height (he's 6'2"). In all, they are well made and are very difficult to tear which is exactly what they are advertised to do.
customer_reviews.author: MomofBoys

customer_reviews.title: Favorite gloves of all time!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite gloves! I work on my cars and bike with these. I have used MANY brands, and none hold up like these. I forget how dirty my hands are sometimes because these just never break. I used to have to switch gloves every hour, but these I can use one pair all day.
customer_reviews.author: Mario V.

customer_reviews.title: Go bigger
customer_reviews.text: Prior I would get the "Simply Right Nitrile Gloves - 200 Ct." ( in Large, but for kitchen work. They don't hold up for garage work. After reading some of the more specific reviews about these black gloves, I went a size bigger, and that was the correct choice. I do like the thicker feel. They didn't get ripped from snags while cleaning my motorcycle, and the longer wrist helped keep me cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Decibel

customer_reviews.title: True to size!
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear large and ordered XL since I saw a lot of reviews say to order 1 size up. They we're too big. They also don't breath as good as other gloves I have used causing hands to sweat more. They are very durable, I use them daily at a shop with little issues besides the ones I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting gloves for large hands.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gloves for the around the shop jobs, such as painting , wood finishing, and cleaning
customer_reviews.author: EAR

customer_reviews.title: I use them all the time...keep one box in my truck...one box in my work barn...another in the garage...keeps the grease out of t
customer_reviews.text: I use them all the time...keep one box in my truck...one box in my work barn...another in the garage...keeps the grease out of the nails...wife like that better...so do I!. Could be a touch thicker...but they are great.
customer_reviews.author: etii

customer_reviews.title: Very nice nitrile gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. I ordered a size larger than normal due to other review comments on this brand running small and they fit well. I use this type of gloves for gardening and doing outside chores around the farm to protect my hands. I also use them indoors when cleaning bathrooms and scrubbing floors. If you dislike getting dirty hands or scrapes and cuts on you hands these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Tauer

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough to reorder again and again
customer_reviews.text: They're black rubber gloves, the nitrile ones for people allergic to latex. They don't stick to each other in the box, have a decent grip, and I just reorder this brand because I know it works.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: They work great at convincing the kids to clean up messes
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as you would expect. Nitrile gloves. Hands get sweaty and they seem to run a little smaller than stated on the package. I use them for mixing e-juice, preparing meats, grilling, and other household uses. They work great at convincing the kids to clean up messes.
customer_reviews.author: Buckbic

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I did because the XL fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a Size Large for rubber gloves, but accidentally ordered XL. I'm glad I did because the XL fit perfectly. These are really thick and durable. They are great for all kinds of projects around the house. They are well worth the money and great quality overall. Much better than what I found in local hardware stores around me.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for messy jobs that require dexterity
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for working on the sanitation system on my boat. Have since used them changing batteries, filters, etc. Easy on/off. No loss in touch or dexterity. No rips or tear yet. Wish I would have bought these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: SitkaCedar

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect these to be such nice quality for the price. They are soft and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the quality and the functional nature
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They're thick enough that I don't get the slimy feeling from some things I've gotten through thinner gloves, but these also don't remove necessary tactile sensation for handling things. They fit well. They're stylish.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Bonus points for extra texture.
customer_reviews.text: On the surface these are your run-of-the-mill black nitrilite gloves, and in that they would be just fine. The fact that they are textured all over (not just the fingertips) is a big bonus. Works just as well for cooking as it does for cleaning and auto maintenance. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty gloves!
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty gloves! These gloves are much thicker than the ones I am finding in my local auto parts store. They can be used for quite a while before they tear or wear through. These gloves save me from over washing my hands!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: buy brandname instead
customer_reviews.text: These rip easily and also have a high defect rate (where the glove is fused together and unusable). They are also the same price as (or more expensive than) brandname gloves like Microflex. I switched to Microflex Supreno SE and have been much more satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves, work very well compared to other Nitrile gloves and do not leave a powder paste if hands get sweaty. The extra length also makes them even better as it covers more of your arm.
customer_reviews.author: jaysin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several boxes of this brand of gloves in the past and found them to be better than anything I had used before. However, this model is superior to the ones I had before. These are actually reusable several times if kept out of strong solvents. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: need black gloves for examination and general clean up these were reasonable so far so good right now not the best, but the best right now could have more texture for griping
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: great gloves for the money, a new alliterative to the ravens i used to buy
customer_reviews.text: awesome gloves. My guys are using one pair for a day instead of having to change out all the time due to them breaking, These are pretty thick but still allow full movement and feeling. I replaced the more expensive raven gloves with these and saved money and have a product the performs just as well
customer_reviews.author: Brad A

customer_reviews.title: Great shop gloves
customer_reviews.text: durable and last for a day on the car, X-large give me enough room for a little bit of breathing but still sweat in them
customer_reviews.author: Booska

customer_reviews.title: GLOVES BREAK FOR NOTHING
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two boxes of these gloves. I gave it two stars because they do not hold up. I'm a transmission rebuilder and I wear these gloves 8-10 hours a day. I would go through 5-6 pairs a day. Spend the extra 2 bucks and BUY the Raven gloves! I love them, when I used them I would only go through 1-2 pairs a day, with the same type of work.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves whenever i do anything with my car, they are great and are a good fit for my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: These gloves have no nasty powder and are kinda tuff.
customer_reviews.text: very nice gloves they fit my huge hands. These gloves have no nasty powder and are kinda tuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, they're thick enough to give a psychological barrier as well as a physical barrier to nastiness. I change 10 of my mother's really nasty adult diapers daily and the gloves, and a mask let me do what has to be done without vomiting every single time like I was before preparing like I do now.
customer_reviews.author: K. kelley-borzello

customer_reviews.title: Mechanic's best friend...
customer_reviews.text: Strong, comfortable and minimal loss of sensitivity/dexterity. Would like to see them offered with powder as an option as a broken glove and a sweaty hand mean lost time without the talc. Yes, I could make a talc duster from an old sock filled with tire talc or baby powder, but I'd just rather have it in the glove to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin from CT

customer_reviews.title: Tear resistant, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Really good value work gloves -- much stronger than the easily shredded, too-thin blue gloves. These will tear and break too -- yet I often will use them for several jobs before needing to pull out new ones. I have long fingers and xl fit well. Only mild complaint -- wish they were a bit longer at the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: havai

customer_reviews.title: Clean Hands = Happy Wife = Happy Life
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for everything from wrenching on the car to handling meats in the smoker. Good fit, good thickness. Not so thick that the numb your senses, not so thin that the tear when you try to put them on. Powder free so keep your hands dry when you put them on. Sized just right.
customer_reviews.author: Ray W.

customer_reviews.title: THICK NITRILE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found the good ones! I have yet to rip them and I'm almost through the whole box. I use these for auto and farm equipment maintenance. I've thrown everything at these things but solvents and they hold up till my hands prune. The slightly textured grip is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: dbbdbb

customer_reviews.title: Simply Incredible. Excellent For Cleaning Guns.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are far superior to any other disposable glove I have ever used. They are worth the extra $3-5/100 by far. I used to use 3-4 pairs of normal nitrile gloves in an hour of cleaning guns because the solvent or a sharp edge of a part would snag them and tear them.These are simply incredible.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Great for mass disinterment and all-day use!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely buy one size up for comfort! Overall sturdy, flexible, and a great fit. On a project for my job we were tasked with disinterring a 19th-century cemetery and bought these because OSHA. With full Tyvek suits, respirators, and these gloves we were 100% safe from all the horrible things that have seeped into the ground. The gloves offered amazing flexibility and durability as we gently scraped and brushed away to disinter each burial carefully.
customer_reviews.author: L. C.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, tactile gloves
customer_reviews.text: Much, much better than "Dynarex Black Nitrile Exam Gloves, Powder Free". These gloves are thicker yet still offer excellent feel and are very durable. I've used one pair multiple times and haven't managed to rip them in situations where the Dynarex gloves would have ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Most break and split on me when ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Most break and split on me when I work on cars. Used half the box without one breakage. I have even taken them off and put them on again. Amazing for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Strier

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Rip or Tear Even With Heavy Use
customer_reviews.text: High quality gloves that do not rip or tear even with heavy use. I use these for protection when using paint & varnish work as well as when doing maintenance on my outdoor power equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Al Smith

customer_reviews.title: great for auto work
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are thick and durable, great for auto work, or cleaning a greasy grill.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite nitrile gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite nitrile gloves. They are very strong and durable. Often, I can reuse several times. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is that they are black. When I use them outside in the sun, they get very hot. I wish they offered them in a lighter color.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in M.I.

customer_reviews.title: Will worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Finally a glove that fits my hands....they are not going to last for your whole job.....but for the cost they do save you from the grease & dirt. I would buy them again...
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne P

customer_reviews.title: Great, tough gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable gloves, highly puncture resistant. Size is a little smaller than I expected, so I'm glad I ordered larger based on other reviews. I've tucked a few pairs here and there (first aid kit, car, etc.) for use in emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Dan McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Fits loosely on large hands. Nice thickness to them. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: RabbitRescuer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tough jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy gloves. The fit is true, no loss in dexterity, even when using fingertips.They do rip if used on sharp metal. I went through two pairs when changing power steering fluid hose. I've been double gloving since.
customer_reviews.author: Bucko

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are great. Thick enough to withstand some abuse
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. Thick enough to withstand some abuse. Not like some that will only last about 15 min.These are thicker and I can do odd jobs around the house and garage and yard w/out them ripping apart
customer_reviews.author: guitsteve

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: You get what you expect with these Diamond gloves. They are very durable, I use them for cleaning my BBQ, and working in greasy environments. They have never ripped, I really like them. I ordered the XL and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Karl S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: thick, doesnt snap or break. high wquality protection for you and your patient
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best
customer_reviews.text: These are good, but there is better stuff out there. As compacted to some other brands I've used, these tear quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Kona-Sean

customer_reviews.title: ... these a long time ago and they are still good as I continue using them
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a long time ago and they are still good as I continue using them. Not a bad one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hap

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mechanics gloves.. pretty thick for being disposable.. I'll plan on buying again
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Finally found some to handle RV sewer hose without the problem of splitting.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Decent Disposable Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gloves, fit well, slide on easy. powder coated with a light coating, you can pick up a dime.
customer_reviews.author: ColdShot

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for mechanics.
customer_reviews.text: Tough yet thin enough so you can feel things, good for mechanics
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Super item
customer_reviews.text: Well worth having in barn and shop. Super heavy duty nitrate gloves even for semi abrasive conditions. Even worked as winter glove liners for dampness
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: They're too think to start an IV but perfect for household / BBQ use.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. Size run true -- I'm an RN so I wear gloves on a regular basis. These are thicker than the normal Nitrile gloves. I use them for BBQ'ing and working on my truck and so they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LynnTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: These are nothing like the ones i bought before
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing like the ones i bought before. This new version frankly sucks, i got hosed second time around.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Super durable and the size is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Super durable and the size is perfect. other XL gloves fit a bit too snug. I will continue to buy these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Trusty Rombone

customer_reviews.title: Camping RV2
customer_reviews.text: These are working. I expected a thicker ply. No grips on palms or fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for yard work
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are heavy enough that you can dig in the dirt or just protect you from the dirt. You could pick up a dime In them they are not bulky like regular gardening gloves. Love them. They do run smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Pickey

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I got tired of trying to get the crud out from under my finger nails- wear these and it's not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B. Kennington

customer_reviews.title: Great for the field
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, high quality. I use them in law enforcement and they work great
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are good gloves, especially for those of us who are latex allergic. Sturdy, not easily torn, easy to put on and take off, comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: K. KingTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Thick enough for automotive use
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves when performing auto repair. It keeps the really nasty grease at bay, as well as the fine brake dust that likes to invade every nook and cranny on my hands. The size seemed OK, maybe a touch small.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burke

customer_reviews.title: and these are the best..
customer_reviews.text: I've probably tried every brand of disposable work gloves, and these are the best... though thin, they're stronger than thicker ones, and they pull on easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanic gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great mechanic gloves for keeping the yuck off of your hands. These durable 7mil gloves don't tear as easy as the others, and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: MudholeTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I have finally found the one I will stick with.
customer_reviews.text: Better than any similar gloves I have used while working on my cars. Strong and resistant to abrasion and fluids.
customer_reviews.author: World Traveler

customer_reviews.title: I use them when working on cars and bikes and they work great. They still will tear but not nearly as ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very strong, I use them when working on cars and bikes and they work great. They still will tear but not nearly as easy as every other kind I've tried. I'm often even able to use them more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Decent clean set, no dust or loose particles. I wish the wrist protection was a bit longer but they fit well on my long fingers.
customer_reviews.author: MaysEffect

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but they run just a little bit smaller than I would have liked.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Brentano

customer_reviews.title: I read a lot of great reviews with an occasional one that scared me about ...
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of great reviews with an occasional one that scared me about inconsistent strength. So far I have not ran into the issue of only the first half the gloves being excellent. These are supper strong, using them for engine repair work and they are indestructible. I would agree with others that they are sized small so go up one size from what you would normally get.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Shane McKelvey

customer_reviews.title: First One Torn Apart Just Pulling it Out of The Box
customer_reviews.text: The first glove I pulled out was already torn apart. Hopefully better ones lie below. Will update accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer, Deep Thinker

customer_reviews.title: Too small by one size at least
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Large and it's barely a Medium. My hand size is 9. Other reviewers have had the same problem. I'd suggest the manufacturer rethink the sizes. I like the quality of the glove and I,m ordering again, this time XL.
customer_reviews.author: R. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Nitrile Glove Fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit my X-large hands perfectly. not too tight or loose. Have used them for a variety of jobs around the house with no issues. Will definitely purchase again when I am running low
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Lister

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tough, long lasting gloves. Hold up well for stains. Order a size larger than you would normally use.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: These are great so far
customer_reviews.text: I am always looking for new gloves. These are great so far! Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great value and keeps my heavy equipment mechanics hands oil free and protected.
customer_reviews.text: These are much better quality and less expensive than what we get delivered from the auto parts supplier O Reilly
customer_reviews.author: Poorshanutt

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived in a timely manner and as advertised. What more could one want?
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy duty gloves that I use for mechanical work to protect from oil, brake fluid, antifreeze and any other substance that one doesn't want on their skin. Great gloves!
customer_reviews.author: J. Marsh

product_meta.title: Diamond Gloves Black Advance Nitrile Examination Powder-Free Gloves, 6.3 mil, Heavy Duty, X-Large, 100 Count
product_meta.description: BLACK ADVANCE nitrile examination powder free gloves. Heavy duty, excellent resistant from moisture and chemicals with good tactile sensitivity and dexterity. One time use only.
feature_bullets: Latex free finger tip thickness: 6.3 mil, no powder lubricant added
Upgrade version of black ravens, medical grade, special for auto industry, law enforcement and tattoo industry
Ambidextrous, textured, beaded, non-sterile. Grip: Finger Micro Textured
Extraordinary strength and puncture resistance while maintaining tactile sensitivity
